article: Are you still wishing your friends and partners "Happy New Year"? In the first few days of a new year, we say these three words countless times. The _ is that we say them almost without thinking. The result of such a wish is that it _ its meaning and power.  Last month, I _ Dada J P Vaswani's first speech after his return from the US. The _ of his speech was "In 2012, all will be fine". While sharing one of his many _ ideas, he said that while "Happy New Year" is a nice greeting, there's a more beautiful and encouraging way to _ others--"Happy New You!" Those three _ words show that New Year is a time to leave behind our _ and step forward. It's the time to renew ourselves by getting rid of the negative things of the past -- _ , pain and so on. It's also the right time to give up thoughts of fear and failure. For those who are _ what to change, Dada has a simple suggestion: write down all the things that you don't _ about yourself... every single one. They could be small or big, easy or difficult -- _ write them all down. Putting them on _ brings clearness of thought, which is the first step towards bringing about any change. So this New Year, let's wish each other "Happy New You" and then _ that trend all through the year. Each time you wish others, you will be _ not only them but also yourself to leave behind sadness and the past -- because it's time for being Happy and New.
